Visit our local small business stores. Match the house number to the map. The Village Chalet Restaurant #4 Tucked in the gardens, The Viliage Chalet is Cauley Square‚Äôs In-house catering restaurant for intimate gatherings or for large garden events www.thevillagechalet.com 305-258-8900 info.villagechalet@gmail.com The Tea Room #6 The Tea Room is known for afternoon high tea, best desserts and brunch service. Dine within the Victorian style inspired rooms behind this Antique Shop. www.tearoommiami.com 305-258-0044 info@tearoommiami.com Jimmy's Bright Idea's #7 Handcrafted creative and eclectic home decor from repurposed vintage finds jimmysbrightideas@gmail.com IG: @jimmysbrightideas Dora Gabay Designer Shop & Gallery #8 Boutique creative fashion shop offering jewelry, dresses, resort wear for men and women with rotating curated artist exhibitions. www.doragabay.store IG: @doragabay Tree of Life Holistic #9 Inside this yellow cottage they offer alternative and holistic services, including Reiki Healing, Meditation and Yoga Classes and Variety of Workshops. 305-850-8750 treeoflifeholisticatcauley@gmail.com IG: @treeoflifeatcauley Ruby's Hair Salon & Unisex #11 Specializing in hair cuts and treatments, body and facials services including nails, massages and facials. 305-257-5083 IG: @rubysplaces_unisex Therapia by Aroma #13 A Follow the floral scents through the back gardens to this apothecary. Creating the world‚Äôs most natural and sensual skincare and fragrances www.therapiabyaroma.com IG: @therapiabyaroma The Children's Gallery #14 A Contemporary, portrait and still gallery. Offering art classes and commission pieces IG: @carlos_franco_art Latin Corner #18 This pop-up gazebo serves everyones favorites from cafesito, cuban sandwiches to juices and shakes. IG: miami_latin_corner 786-325-5327 Cauley Square About Shops Calendar

(map) Google Calendar ICS Cesar is a world-renowned historian author - known for his books on the Florida Everglades, Mary Brickell and Robert is Here to name a few. During the tour - he will be dicussing the history of Cauley Square, the Redlands and Florida Eastcoast Railway with details on Willam H Cauley & Henry Flagler. Tour are an hour long ending at once stopping ground Saloon - The Village Chalet - for a courtesy sangria, mimosa, wine beer or lemonade. Whatever your preference is! Meet at the caboose, start time is sharp. This is a limited engagement, see all future dates. Contume Contest | Giveaway Baskets | Fun Activities |For all ages For more information, please contact Tree of Life Store: treeoflifeholisticatcauley@gmail.com | 305-850-8750 View Event ‚Üí Oct 16 Jeep & Truck Show Sunday, October 16, 2022 11:00‚ÄØAM 4:00‚ÄØPM 22400 Old Dixie Hwy, 2nd FL (map) Google Calendar ICS Jeep & Truck Show 2022 Registration begins at 10AM. Show starts at 11AM. Supporting Breast Cancer  Awareness Month. Join us for a day of great music, food + drinks and vendors. To participate in the Jeeps & Trucks Cruise - please contact Jorge at 786-317-0341 Protion of the proceeds go towards helping local community patients. View Event ‚Üí Oct 9 Fall Bookworms Festival Sunday, October 9, 2022 11:00‚ÄØAM 6:05‚ÄØPM 22400 Old Dixie Hwy, 2nd FL (map) Google Calendar ICS Join us for our very first Fall Bookworms Festival with our local shop Sweet Haven Books . Sunday, October 9th, will be a day full of activities for all ages! Forest fairies in the morning with our very own fairy helping you create your fairy crown and wand! Games and meet and greets are free! No entrance charge! We will also have fall games for the entire family all day! Afternoon fall crafts for adults with champagne included and meet and greet with local authors for signings, raffles and prizes! To get tickets for the forest fairies event please visit: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/fairy-forests-event-for-kids-tickets-421203169017 Tickets for the adult fall crafts with champagne: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/fall-crafts-with-champagne-tickets-421205816937 View Event ‚Üí Sep 18 Bodhi & Mind Festival Sunday, September 18, 2022 11:00‚ÄØAM 6:00‚ÄØPM 22400 Old Dixie Hwy, 2nd FL (map) Google Calendar ICS Its mission is encouraging local holistic entrepreneurship, while contributing to individual, community and global balance between mind, physical body and spirit. Cauley Square Historical Village will be once again a Portal of light for Miami! Holistic therapies will include Reiki, Astrology, Bioenergy, Biomagnetism, Chromatherapy, Crystals and Aromatherapy, Quantum Medicine, Sacred Geometry, Ayurveda, , Sustainable living, Numerology, Reflexology, Meditation, Reconnection, Neuroscience, Laughter Yoga, Metaphysics, Massage, Yoga, Aura reading, Feng Shui, Chakra Balancing, Tantra Healing, Reading of intuitive Tarot among many others! Furthermore, a wide variety of products, services, great food, lots of fun activities and performers, DJ, children mini village, featuring dynamic Speakers, Movement Meditations, Yoga, Dance, Art, Music, and vendors that will bring your life to new levels of fulfillment in an unprecedented day! Interested in joining us as a vendor email: events@cauleysquare.com View Event ‚Üí Aug 26 Live Music & Art Classes with Dora Gabay Friday, August 26, 2022 7:00‚ÄØPM 9:00‚ÄØPM Cauley Square (map) Google Calendar ICS Spend the afternoon outside in our gardens, painting with talented artist Dora Gabay and special at teachers.  Held on selective Saturdays and Sundays through Jan. Classes include materials and seating. Open to private group reservations. Please call the shop directly for booking details : Call: 908-674-0382   | Email: dgabayllc@gmail.com View Event ‚Üí May 8 Live Jazz on Mother's Weekend Sunday, May 8, 2022 1:00‚ÄØPM 5:00‚ÄØPM 22400 Old Dixie Hwy, 2nd FL (map) Google Calendar ICS We invite you to celebrate Mothers Day Weekend at The Village Chalet ¬†with Live Jazz from 1:00P - 5:00P with special menu Reservations recommend - email: info.villagechalet@gmail.com View Event ‚Üí May 7 Live Jazz on Mother's Weekend Saturday, May 7, 2022 6:30‚ÄØPM 10:30‚ÄØPM 22400 Old Dixie Hwy, 2nd FL (map) Google Calendar ICS We invite you to celebrate Mothers Day Weekend at The Village Chalet ¬†with Live Jazz from 6:30P - 10:30P Reservations recommend - email: info.villagechalet@gmail.com View Event ‚Üí Apr 9 History, S‚Äômores and Campfire with Cesar Becerra Saturday, April 9, 2022 6:00‚ÄØPM 7:00‚ÄØPM 22400 Old Dixie Hwy, 2nd FL (map) Google Calendar ICS Join Cesar Becerra at Tree of Life near the campfire whilst he tells stories of history over three decades covering details in his latest book ORANGE BLOSSOM 2.0 View Event ‚Üí Mar 5 History, S‚Äômores and Campfire with Cesar Becerra Saturday, March 5, 2022 6:00‚ÄØPM 7:00‚ÄØPM 22400 Old Dixie Hwy, 2nd FL (map) Google Calendar ICS Join Cesar Becerra at Tree of Life near the campfire whilst he tells stories of history over three decades covering details in his latest book ORANGE BLOSSOM 2.0 View Event ‚Üí Mar 5 Florida‚Äôs Living History Tour Saturday, March 5, 2022 11:00‚ÄØAM 12:00‚ÄØPM 22400 Old Dixie Hwy. (map) Google Calendar ICS Mysteries¬†and histories¬†of Cauley Square are the focus of historian and storyteller Cesar A. Becerra as he takes you on an intimate tour of the nooks, crannies and¬†canopies of this gem in South Dade County. In full railroad conductor outfit or even as Henry Flagler - it will be a surprise. Becerra will entertain, educate and lead a leisurely stroll beginning at the colorful and iconic red caboose. Limited spacing, purchase your tickets today!                         5 Important Things To Consider Banquet Halls and Wedding Venues in Florida Miami Cauley Square Historic Village Miami, Florida Venue Info Photos Congratulations on your engagement! Thank you for your interest in Cauley Square Historic Village. We offer a romantic garden setting for your wedding ceremony and reception. Cauley Square Historic Village promises an affair to remember! With its 10 acres of shaded garden paths and massive trees we have the perfect place to make an everlasting memory in your life. Call us today at our bridal consultation line 305-258-2565 or email us at events@cauleysquare.com to schedule your complimentary wedding tour of the scenic venues available at our beautiful village. Log in Get started Wedding websites Wedding venues Vendors Registry Invites and paper Guest list Budget Boutique Albums Mobile app Team-Z advisors Expert Advice Inspiration Honeymoons FAQs Contact us Find a couple Zola Baby Zola Home Zola for vendors Zola Baby Zola Home Zola for vendors Plan your wedding Expert advice Find a couple Log in Get started Wedding Vendors / Wedding and reception venues / Florida venues / Miami, FL venues / Cauley Square Historic Village View all ( 16 +) 16 Cauley Square Historic Village 5.0 ( 2 reviews ) Guest capacity Up to 150 seated guests About this venue Cauley Square Historic Village is a wedding venue located in Miami, Florida. This nostalgic event space offers couples and their guests a glimpse of South Florida from days gone by. When holding your nuptials here, you will be provided with a one-of-a-kind experience to treasure for a lifetime. The venue offers an incredibly affordable all inclusive option for 100 guests which included dinner, drinks, all tables and chairs etc, DJ, and photographer--making the wedding planning so much easier. All I needed to do was book make up artists (the venue has a bridal suite for getting ready), buy a dress and set up some DIY decorations. The venue itself is incredibly charming, we got rave reviews from our guests who loved the atmosphere. Food is prepared by an onsite restaurant and so it was actually really delicious. And Abby (day of coordinator/wedding planner) was the sweetest and so incredibly helpful. Because of poor weather, we needed to move the reception indoors and set up tents for the outdoor ceremony. Abby made sure everything looked amazing and facetimed me the day before so I could see how the indoor set up was coming along. When I was disappointed that the reception could not be outdoors, the owner purchased new outdoor lights to create a little outdoor area for guests to hang out. This venue truly goes above and beyond! A hidden gem for sure!! Preferred vendors of Cauley Square Historic Village Planner Signature Essence (Ashley Maxwell) Frequently asked questions 11 Answers Ask them a question Can we bring our own alcohol? Our establishment employs our own bartenders with bar services as we are fully licensed and insured. Do you have on-site parking? Absolutely, valet parking is provided as part of our packages for events hosting more than 50 guests. For smaller gatherings, complimentary parking is available. How do we get to your venue from the nearest airport? On average, our venue is approximately a 30-minute drive from Miami International Airport and about 45 minutes from Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport. Do we need to get insurance? Couples are required to obtain event insurance, the cost of which varies depending on the number of guests. For weddings with 100 to 150 guests, the insurance can range from $125 to $175. How many hours are included in our booking? If you host an event with over 50 guests, you'll have access to the bridal suite and groom suite starting as early as 9 am for preparation. Venue rental spans up to six hours from the ceremony time, with the option to extend it until midnight. What‚Äôs your cancellation policy? If you wish to cancel the event, please understand that refunds will not be issued for payments already made, regardless of the cancellation timing. This policy isn't intended to be harsh; rather, it's because we could have potentially allocated the venue to another party had we been notified sooner. What‚Äôs included in your starting rental fee? Get in touch with us for detailed information. Each wedding is unique, and we strive to tailor a package that perfectly aligns with your requirements. Do you have accessible facilities? The majority of our spaces are designed to be wheelchair accessible. Do you have accessible facilities? The majority of our spaces are wheelchair accessible. We suggest arranging a tour to experience the venue firsthand and determine if it meets your requirements. What is your peak season? The peak months for weddings typically fall between January and May, as well as from October to December. What is your off-peak season? Our wedding season experiences a slight decrease in activity during June, July, August, and September. Ask them a question Want them for your wedding? Get a quote Want them for your wedding? Nestled between the unique treasures of Everglades National Park and Biscayne National Park lies an area rich in history, beauty, tropical climate and tempting food. Historic Redland Trail & Our History ‚Äî Cauley Square Historic Village 0 Skip to Content Home Shops About Us Gallery Weddings Photo Permit Calendar Contact Open Menu Close Menu Home Shops About Us Gallery Weddings Photo Permit Calendar Contact Open Menu Close Menu Home Shops About Us Gallery Weddings Photo Permit Calendar Contact Our Story The story began by a tale rooted in agriculture and Henry Flagler‚Äôs railroad. Most pioneering farmers who settled south of Miami were glad when the Florida East Coast Railway brought sidings like the one that was operated by a railroad employee named Goulds. In 1903, it was initially referred to as Gould‚Äôs Siding, then simply as Goulds. Whatever the name, the railroad provided a far more efficient means of shipping Redland‚Äôs produce for men like William Cauley , and having a siding close to your property was especially beneficial. Cauley, began a large shipping operation, however, there are logistical needs and since Cauley owned ten acres alongside the railroad tracks, he set about building a two-story warehouse and office that was completed in what was known as the flat iron style blended with a touch of Spanish architecture; now know as the main building at Cauley Square. Then came packing houses, but his workers, and those still building the railroad, required places to live, eat, and relax. Wooden houses, a saloon, and other structures soon filled Cauley Square ; a village that acquired a reputation for being a rowdy place. There were stories of booze, brawls, and a bordello in between a tornado in 1919 and the great 1926 Miami Hurricane. Despite rebuilding from weather-related destruction, economic realities eventually took a toll with the Great Depression, World War II, and population expansion pushing out agriculture. Cauley Square began a steady decline until Miami-Dade County finally condemned the aging collection of buildings and slated them for demolition. Enter Mary Anne Ballard , a Floridian who had moved to Redland with her husband in 1949, established her own Interior Design business, and possessed a love of history and art. She was active in numerous conservation efforts and saw the faded beauty in the two-story building that had been the focal point of Cauley Square. The Ballard‚Äôs purchased it, the land, and a few houses, and at age 65, what was to be Ballard‚Äôs retirement became instead a plan to restore Cauley Square. Her ultimate goal was to establish a youth center, an adult education center, and a school for the arts. The path to this would be to create an enclave of charming shops and a place to dine within a picturesque setting suitable for strolling. The vision began with bringing in more of the small, handcrafted pioneer houses from the surrounding Redland and carefully transforming them into individual businesses. The Tea Room Restaurant, opened in 1979, filled with delicate china, crystal, and lace, was like stepping back into time, and its popularity achieved part of Ballard‚Äôs dream. Other quaint cottages were then converted, nestled among mature trees and tropical foliage. In the midst of the transformation though Cauley Square was not spared the fury of Hurricane Andrew, and damage was priced at over $1 million. Ballard once again fought to find funding and Cauley Square was not only re-opened, but in 1994, it was officially declared a Historical Site. It was a challenge to maintain, however, and after Ballard passed away in 1998, financial problems loomed. In 2001, Cauley Square was purchased by its current owner.  While the adopted region began to loose section after section of historical architecture. ‚ÄúI wanted to give back to my community,‚Äù she said, ‚Äúto protect this little island.‚Äù Although it took ten years, the beautifully re-landscaped grounds, the fountains, the walkways that can accommodate wheelchairs, are all part of the plan. While the Tea Room continues to be popular, they thought something a little less feminine was in order and she renovated another cottage to create the Village Chalet Restaurant. A crowning touch among the twenty-five restored structures is a small chapel that she transformed in gratitude for having a ‚Äúblessed life‚Äù, and as a spot for people to stop into for quiet reflection. Today, Cauley Square continues to thrive as a hidden gem in South Florida. We look forward meeting you. Cauley Square About Shops Calendar
